page.title: 12LIFE IN WATER END
page.content: Mr & Mrs Brook's HOMELIFE revolves around the village of Water End where they have been living for 25 yrs. They have been involved with the church ever since they came to live in Water End.Mr Brook is on the PARISH council.Their local church is in Gt Gaddesden and dates from early Norman times. The Brooks moved to Water End because they liked the countryside and wished to renovate an old house. Their house dates from about the 16 century. They have a garden of 1 acre & grow fruit & vegetables & keep bees. They have two grown-up children. They use a car for TRANSPORT. They say that since they arrived in the village there have been many CHANGES including a rise in the population,an increase in the traffic,the removal of the Post Office,and underground electricity instead of overhead.
